learning_outcomes.description: Develop appropriate process engineering diagrams and perform mass and energy balances on complex flowsheets.
Use a systematic approach for analysing and developing chemical engineering processes.
Use a systematic approach for synthesising and developing chemical engineering processes.
Use Aspen Plus simulations for process development.
Carry out costing and economic analyses to determine the feasibility of a new process.
Work effectively in an engineering project team to develop new chemical engineering processes.
Communicate process information at a professional standard in both written and oral formats.

assessments.due_date:
Project report 6/09/2024 5:00 pm

Project presentation will be organised in Week8 Tutorial section.
assessments.task_description:
This is a project to apply process analysis skills. The product to be examined is selected by the team with a project report delivered in week 7 (20% of total assessment) and a presentation delivered in week 8 (5% of total assessment). Peer assessment on team criteria will determine a Peer Assessment Factor (PAF) for individual team members.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.

Project hurdle is applied in this course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission of project reports via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Assessments must be submitted on or before the due date. Late submissions of assessment items will only be accepted if approval for late submission has been obtained prior to the due date.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: Week9 tutorial section will be used for this assessment.
assessments.task_description:
In this assessment, students will be given a process engineering scenario and example process data. Students are required to work individually to draw block flow diagrams, build and run Aspen simulations and present simulation results.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Answer sheets must be submitted within the time allocated.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Assessments must be submitted on or before the due date. Late submissions of assessment items will only be accepted if approval for late submission has been obtained prior to the due date.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This is a project to apply process synthesis skills with a project report delivered in week 13 (30% of total assessment). Peer assessment on team criteria will determine a Peer Assessment Factor (PAF) for individual team members.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.

Project hurdle is applied in this course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission of project reports via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Assessments must be submitted on or before the due date. Late submissions of assessment items will only be accepted if approval for late submission has been obtained prior to the due date.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Individual final exam tests understanding of all aspects of the course material from lectures, tutorials and project work. No written materials are permitted. No electronic aids are permitted (e.g. laptops, phones).

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

Exam hurdle is applied in this course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(22 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

A series of Lectures covers the principles required for process analysis, synthesis, simulation, costing and financial evaluation. Lectures are recorded and will be available in the course blackboard page. A semester plan showing the weekly lecture topic is available on the course blackboard page.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures A series of Lectures covers the principles required for process analysis, synthesis, simulation, costing and financial evaluation. Lectures are recorded and will be available in the course blackboard page. A semester plan showing the weekly lecture topic is available on the course blackboard page.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(22 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Tutorials

The Tutorials aim to put lecture materials into practise and assist with development of practical skills for process analysis, synthesis, simulation, costing and financial evaluation. Students will be trained on using process simulation solftware during tutorial sections. Tutorial sessions are NOT RECORDED, however worked solutions are provided for tutorial problems. A semester plan showing the weekly tutorial topic is available on the course blackboard page.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07
